intro: Malva lutea, commonly known as the yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known species like cotton and hibiscus. Malva lutea typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
